poem:
### The Promise of Tomorrow

In the shadow of towers,  
Promises build like mist,  
Affordable dreams whispered  
By lips of government;  
A billion here, a billion there,  
Hope laid in brick and stone—  
Yet profits tumble,  
A silent fall in cold streets,  
Dividend dreams suspended,  
As the earth waits, unchanging,  
For the hand that mends.
